text: Paul Carey (March 15, 1928 â€“ April 12, 2016) was an American broadcaster and sportscaster. He broadcast professionally in six different decades. He is a member of the Michigan Sports Hall of Fame. He was known for broadcasting the Detroit Tigers games and for producing the Detroit Tigers Radio Network from 1964 to 1971. Carey died on April 12, 2016 in Rochester, Michigan from complications of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), at the age of 88. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from COPD Category:Sportspeople from Michigan
title: Paul Carey
